headline.main: Catholic Hospitals and Rape Victims; Medical Treatment at Your Supermarket (2 Letters)

keywords.value: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Lethal injections are often botched and sometimes painful. Doctors don’t want to administer them. Is it time to kill this form of execution?

headline.seo: The Needle and the Damage Done - Elizabeth Weil
headline.main: The Needle and the Damage Done
headline.print_headline: The Needle and the Damage Done

docs.snippet: Lethal injections are often botched and sometimes painful. Doctors don’t want to administer them. Is it time to kill this form of execution?

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your Feb. 4 editorial ''Compassion for Rape Victims'' promotes a Connecticut bill that would force all hospitals to give ''emergency contraception'' to rape victims on request.
docs.abstract: US Conference of Catholic Bishops Secretariat for Pro-Life Activities planning and information director Deirdre A McQuade letter opposes February 4 editorial supporting Connecticut bill that would force all hospitals to give emergency contraception to rape victims on request
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Your Feb. 4 editorial ''Compassion for Rape Victims'' promotes a Connecticut bill that would force all hospitals to give ''emergency contraception'' to rape victims on request.
